translation.resume.narration:
Welcome back! Do you want to continue your story from where you last left 
        off?
translation.start.narration: Greetings, explorer. Welcome to the Desert Adventurer experience.
translation.Lost in Desert.narration: The blowing hot wind scorches the surface of both the earth and your skin. You walk aimlessly in the desert, thirsty for water. <break time='0.5s'/> <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo/Heavy_footsteps_01.mp3'/> In the middle of the hot desert, you found a rusty, old signpost. It has two arrows pointing to the right and the left, but their names have faded away.
translation.Tutorial 1: Direction Questions.narratio: <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>When you hear this sound, you will be deciding which path, or direction, to take. In this case, try saying: go to the left, or go to the right.
translation.Tutorial 1: Direction Questions.reprompt: You can say, look left or look right.
translation.Look Right.narration: You wiped your face with your dry hands and decided to turn right. Then, you keep treading the sea of powdered rocks wearily.
translation.Tutorial 1A: Check Around.narration: You walked under the hot sun until you have reached the top of a little sand hill. It grants you some height advantage. Now you can see what's around you. <break time='0.5s'/> <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>Sometimes, paths aren't obvious at first glance just like now. You can check around first by saying what's around me. Go on, give it a go.
translation.Tutorial 1A: Check Around.reprompt: You can check around by saying "check what's around me".
translation.Tutorial 1A: Check Around.recap: You can check around by saying "check what's around me".
translation.Check Around the Hill.narration: You look around, like a compass slowly spinning. You don't find anything particularly interesting. <break time='0.5s'/> Wait! You see a few freckles on the yellow surfaces of Earth. It shines under the burning sun! You squint your eyes and look closer. <break time='0.5s'/> <emphasis level="reduced">It's a town!</emphasis> <break time='0.2s'/> There's a good chance that they have some water there.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>
translation.Check Around the Hill.reprompt: You might want to go to a location?
translation.Check Around the Hill.recap: You might want to go to a location? try say go to the town?
translation.Go to Town.narration: Quick! There might be water there.
translation.Town.narration: The urge of cold water passing through dry lungs has dragged your weary feet to the entrance of the town. You thought the townspeople would step forward immediately to help a thirsty traveler, but instead. <break time='0.2s'/> No-one came. What's happening? <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/> you can ask to check the environment. Try saying: "what's around me?"
translation.Town.reprompt: you can ask to check the environment. Try saying: "what's around me?"
translation.Town.recap: you can ask to check the environment. Try saying: "what's around me?"
translation.Around.narration: You're at the entrance of the town. Some small buildings align on the sides of the street. But all of their doors are shut tight. Only a few people are walking on the streets. It's almost as if they're trying to avoid having eye-contact with you.
translation.Around.reprompt: There are a few establishments right in front of you. a general store and the mayor's office. Could any of them have some water? Choose a location to go to.
translation.Around.recap: There are a few establishments right in front of you. a general store and the mayor's office. Could any of them have some water? Choose a location to go to.
translation.Around_1.narration: There are a few establishments right in front of you. A general store and the mayor's office. Could any of them have some water? <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>
translation.Around_1.reprompt: There are a few establishments right in front of you. A general store and the mayor's office. Could any of them have some water? <break time='0.2s'/> Choose a location to go to.
translation.Around_1.recap: There are a few establishments right in front of you. A general store and the mayor's office. Could any of them have some water? <break time='0.2s'/> Choose a location to go to.
translation.Store.narration: Upon approaching the general store, you see a boy. He wears a red coat, and you can see surprised written all over his face. <break time='0.8s'/><voice name='Justin'> You are a new face here. Do you need help? <break time='0.2s'/> You don't look well.</voice> <break time='0.8s'/> Maybe the little boy has water. You can ask if there's water. <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/> When you hear this sound, you decide what to say to the other person next. For example, right now you can say: ask the boy for water. <break time='0.2s'/> Try it!
translation.Boy.narration:
You asked the boy for some water. 
		<voice name='Justin'> 
	    I can help you with that. <break time='0.2s'/> But I must warn you. <break time='0.2s'/> Situations in the house aren't exactly desirable. <break time='0.2s'/> In a sense.</voice> <break time='0.5s'/>
		The boy takes you around the building and enters the store from the backdoor. <break time='0.5s'/> Oh dear. <break time='0.5s'/> It is far from being desirable. The air in the store is nothing of this world. It's foul and revolting. Each step you take is like a deeper dive into the bowels of a carnivorous beast. <break time='0.5s'/>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		Yeah. Told you. Papa! <break time='0.5s'/> </voice> 
		<break time='0.5s'/> A bald, middle-aged man that looks like in his fifties are slowly walks down the stairs. <break time='0.5s'/> Small pieces of tissue paper are rolled and stuck in his nose. He looks like he could use some more sunshine.
translation.Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
        Who is this person? <break time='0.5s'/> Why did you bring a stranger that looks like a dying cactus to this place? </voice> 
        <voice name='Justin'> 
        <break time='0.5s'/>Relax, papa. He's just a traveler. And he needs water. <break time='0.5s'/>A lot of water.</voice> 
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Water? <break time='0.5s'/> Hah! I got lots of water. As if water would do anything to wash this stench away.</voice> 
        <break time='0.5s'/> 
        The young boy's father handed you a big glass of water. 
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Hey. <break time='0.5s'/> Don't worry. I know it smells bad in here. But I assure you, the water is clean. <break time='0.5s'/> Go on, drink up. Ahh. Yes, the water is fresh and good.</voice>
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
        Sometimes when appropriate, you can use an item, perform an action, or do nothing. For this instance, you can either say: <break time='0.2s'/> use water or do nothing.
translation.Shopkeeper.reprompt: Sometimes when appropriate, you can use an item, perform an action, or do nothing. For this instance, you can either say: <break time='0.2s'/> "use water", or "do nothing".
translation.Shopkeeper.recap: Sometimes when appropriate, you can use an item, perform an action, or do nothing. For this instance, you can either say: <break time='0.2s'/> "use water", or "do nothing".
translation.Don't Drink.narration:
You hold the glass of water at your hand, but you don't drink from it. <break time='0.5s'/>
    <voice name='Brian'>
    <emphasis level="strong">Hmmmm.</emphasis> <break time='0.5s'/> </voice>
    The shopkeeper looks at the glass of water. He looks down on the dusty floor.
    <voice name='Brian'>
    Suit yourself. Thought you were really thirsty. </voice>
    <break time='0.8s'/> At least you're in the shade, so you're starting to feel a little bit less thirsty. But still, the stench is unbearable.
    <voice name='Brian'>
    Maybe the smell even went in the water, but we just don't know. <break time='0.8s'/> It wasn't like this before the incident. </voice>
    <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Finding Out.narration:
The father has given you his word that the water is clean for drinking. But even without his promise you'd still chug the whole glass of water, bottoms-up.
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        The desert in your body is no more. Right now it is a lagoon of spring water, cool splashes of comfort travels to every corner of your body, like ice on melting lava. It's almost as if you could hear the hiss.
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Feel better? You really looked like the desert's going to get you.</voice> 
        Now it's just the stench that's really
        giving you a headache.
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Sorry for the bad manners back there. It's just this town has never since a single visitor for a long time. Not after the incident.</voice>
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>You should ask him.
translation.Finding Out.reprompt: You can talk to him by saying talk to the shopkeeper
translation.Finding Out.recap: You can talk to him by saying talk to the shopkeeper
translation.Ask Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>A while ago the town was famed for our Shawarma. People would come all the way from cities to this dune for a taste of it.<break time='0.5s'/> By the way. What's your name, traveler?</voice>
		<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.Ask for Help.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 
		That's a rare name around here. <break time='0.5s'/> Anyway, {playerName_},  this is a desert so you could imagine it never rains here <break time='0.2s'/> until that night. <break time='0.5s'/> On that night. We've seen the greatest thunderstorm of the town's history, <break time='0.2s'/> but no-one anticipated what came after.</voice>
        <voice name='Justin'>
        <break time='0.8s'/> And then the next morning, my dad started sweating like a cow. So did everyone else. But not me.</voice>
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Yeah. <break time='0.5s'/> We were like broken faucets. But what's worse was what happens afterward. <break time='0.2s'/>That's right. the stench. This stench. It kept everyone from talking to each other. It drove tourists away. And now, no-one wants to come to our town anymore.</voice>
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        The shopkeeper points to a poster on the left wall. It has some dust and the colors have started to fade away, but it's still pretty clear. 
        <voice name='Brian'>
        The mayor believed that it's a curse from some spell caster. He was trying to find people to help. Even set up a great reward for anyone who lifts the curse. 
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        Since you're here, why don't you help us? <break time='0.2s'/> There's a lucrative treasure, and it could be all yours. In the meantime, you can look around the store. No worries.</voice>
        It seems like they really need your help. Do you want to help them?
translation.Ask for Help.reprompt: It seems like they really need your help.
translation.Ask for Help.recap: It seems like they really need your help. Do you want to help them?
translation.Mayor Office.narration: You've arrived at the mayor's office. It's the largest building in the town, but it's doors and windows are tightly shut and locked. <break time='0.2s'/> When you get close to the front door, there's a sharp smell of hot pepper. Looks like there's no way in. <break time='0.5s'/> If you don't know where to go, remember to say What's around me.
translation.Mayor Office.reprompt: Pick a place you want to go to
translation.Mayor Office.recap:
If you don't know where to go, remember to say What's around me.
    <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>Pick the other place
translation.Look Left.narration: You wipe your face with your dry hands and decide to turn left. <break time='0.5s'/> Then, you keep treading the sea of powdered rocks wearily.
translation.Decide to Help.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
	    Ha-haaah! <break time='0.5s'/> This is our lucky day, son. Finally a person who is willing to help us. Well, I guess I shouldn't be keeping here for too long, eh? </voice>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		But papa, you haven't told him anything about how to solve the problem. </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'>
		Oh yes, yes. hey, perhaps you can go ask if the mayor knows anything more. After all, he's the who put up this poster. Maybe he knows more.</voice>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		But the mayor is also locking himself up. No one has seen him for a while. </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Ha! This, my son, is when being the owner of the ONLY general store in the town comes in handy <break time='0.2s'/> Kungh kungh, you see, the mayor has a secret craving for Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce. <break time='0.2s'/> And guess who's selling it? Me! Ha haaah! </voice>
translation.Decide to Help 2.narration:
<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
		You can ask about the mayor, ask about the sauce, or ask for one bottle
translation.Decide to Help 2.recap: You can ask about the mayor, ask about the sauce, or ask for one bottle
translation.Ask Shopkeeper About the Mayor.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
        The mayor has a strange craving for hot sauce. The mayor has turned down guests since the incident. <break time='0.2s'/> The mayor didn't do anything to help the town either. Nobody knows if he's even in his office anymore. </voice>
translation.Ask Shopkeeper About the Sauce.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
        I can only say, the hot sauce is really hot, <break time='0.2s'/> and it looks blue. Like the gas stoves you see in your kitchen, hot, hot, hot! </voice>
translation.One Bottle of Sauce.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>  
        One bottle of Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce, coming right up! </voice> 
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/findingThings1.mp3"/> 
        <voice name='Brian'>  
        Hmmm, where is it? </voice> 
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/findingThings2.mp3"/> 
        <voice name='Justin'>  
        Dad, didn't you just sell one to the Mrs. Chilirosa yesterday? </voice> 
        <voice name='Brian'>  
        Hmm, Oh yes, yes! I did sold one to her. <break time='0.2s'/> Oh dear. I guess that's our last bottle in a while. Next batch is not coming in a week, and I need to drive all the way out of town to get it because they can't stand our stench! </voice> 
        <voice name='Justin'>  
        Stop murmuring, dad. <break time='0.2s'/> Anyways, if you go ask Mrs. Chilirosa, she might have still have some left for you.</voice>
translation.One Bottle of Sauce 2.narration: Now you can leave the store or see what else does the shopkeeper sell, or ask more about Mrs. Chilirosa.
translation.One Bottle of Sauce 2.recap: Now you can leave the store or ask more about Mrs. Chilirosa.
translation.Ask more about Chilirosa.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 
        She's a stubborn old lady who works at the hair salon down the street. Like the mayor, she also has a craving for spicy things. </voice>
        <voice name='Justin'> 
        Yeah! All my friends who visited her shop came out with hair that smelled spicy for days! </voice>
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        But I know what she also likes. <break time='0.2s'/> As funny as it may sound, she also likes roses. But I doubt you'll be finding any of them around. Not in this desert.</voice>
        Now you can leave the store, or ask again
translation.Ask more about Chilirosa.recap: Now you can leave the store, or ask again
translation.Leave the Store.narration:
Just as you are about to leave the store, the shopkeeper stops you.
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Wait wait. The desert is hot and wide. Don't want you to starve or get thirsty out there. Take these. </voice>
        The shopkeeper gives you a big bread and a full canteen of water. They both look edible, but at the same time the stench attaches to them. 
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/doorOpen2.mp3'/>
        You step out of the store.
translation.The Cross.narration: <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>There are a few things that you may want to check: A signpost, the mayor's office to your left, or you can go find the beauty salon.
translation.Signpost.narration: You come forward to the signpost across the lonely street. There are a few items on it. <break time='0.2s'/> It reads: the right leads to the mayor's office, Chilirosa's Beauty Salon, and the Eastern exit of the town. You've also noticed that there are a few strings of ivy tangling around the signpost. They look surprisingly healthy.
translation.Mayor's Office.narration:
You're at the mayor's office. The doors are shut tight, and they seem like their locked. Somehow with the stench, it also smells very spicy. Besides knocking on the door, the office is so big that you probably need to shout to get his attention. What will you do?
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>   Now you can: Knock, bash, or try to open the door, check out the trash can, or go to another location.
translation.Knock On Mayor's Office.narration: You knocked on the door, but nobody answers.
translation.Bash On Mayor's Office.narration: You bashed heavily on the door, but nothing happened.
translation.Check Out the Trash Can.narration: You checked out the trash can, but it's empty.
translation.Beauty Salon.narration:
You started walking towards the end of the street.

        Nothing but the sandy gusts of wind blow into your ears. No one is visible on the street. The buildings on the way look pretty modern, but they are all coated with a thick layer of dust. While you're on your way, you noticed something peculiar in the corner of one of the buildings. It's a patch of green.
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/footsteps2.mp3'/>
translation.Arrive Beauty Salon.narration:
You're at the front door of the beauty salon. Looks like its doors are shut tight, but they don't look locked, and you hear the sounds of radio inside. Anyways, you should talk to her, but what should you do?
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>Now you can: Knock on the door, bash on the door, open the door directly, or check on the green patch before.
translation.Knock On Beauty Salon.narration: No one responds. Knock again or knock harder?<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Knock On Beauty Salon.recap: You can try knock again or knock harder
translation.Knock On Beauty Salon 2.narration: You hear a crank in the house, but still no response. <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Knock On Beauty Salon 2.recap: You can try knock again or knock harder.
translation.Chilirosa Annoyed.narration:
<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/peopleWalkingFast.mp3'/>
         <voice name="Kimberly">
        Yes? What do you want?</voice> 
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/doorOpen2.mp3'/>
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa with flower.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Oh, my! Is THAT for me?</voice>
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa with flower.recap:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        I believe it is for me, right?</voice>
translation.Chilirosa Bargains.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Please, roses are very hard to find in this stinky town. I can pay you.</voice> <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.Chilirosa No Rose Annoyed.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        What do you want? If you have nothing else please leave. This town is already a skunk and I would appreciate if you close the door to stop the stinky air coming in.</voice> 
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/> 
        Now you can ask about the hot sauce, or leave.
translation.Give Mrs Chilirosa the flower.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Why, thank you, dear... What's your name? </voice>
        <amazon:effect name="whispered">say your name!</amazon:effect>.
translation.Give Mrs Chilirosa the flower.recap: maybe try a more common one?
translation.Answer Your Name.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Oh, thank you, dear {playerName}. What can I give you in exchange? </voice>
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa.narration: <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>Now, it's time to ask her about the sauce.
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa.reprompt: She is waiting for your response.
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa.recap: You can try to say "Ask about the sauce".
translation.Ask about the Sauce 1.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        yeah, what about it? You want it? </voice>
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.Ask about the Sauce.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Give me a reason why you need hot sauce. You want hot sauce because? </voice>
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>So we have two plans here: Plan A, You tell her how you like the sauce; Plan B, tell her that you need it to get the mayor's attention. Which plan you wanna go?
translation.Ask about the Sauce.recap: We have two plans here: Plan A, make up a reason and lie; Plan B, tell her that you need it to get the mayor's attention. Which plan you wanna go?
translation.utterance-tell her that I need it to get: tell her that I need it to get the mayor's attention
translation.Tell Mrs Chilirose you like the Sauce.na: Ok. Now make up a good reason why you like the sauce. You can say the sentence start with <break time='0.5s'/>"My reason is"<break time='4s'/>
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Hmmmm. <break time='0.2s'/> Weird reason, but ok. </voice>
        She gleefully hands over the hot sauce to you. You exit the building.
translation.Tell Mrs Chilirose Honestly.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Don't mention the mayor to me. He's been dominating all the hot sauce. but seeing that you're not a hot sauce, i guess you have a good reason to meet him. I'll give you half a bottle.
translation.Chilirosa Give Hot Sauce.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Here is the hot sauce, take it.</voice>
        She hands over the hot sauce to you. You exit the building.
translation.Open the Beauty Salon Directly.narration: you tried to open the door directly, you entered! Then you noticed there is a hot sauce on the desk. That's it! you took it quietly and sneaked out.
translation.check the Green Patch.narration: You walk back to the patch of green sitting in the corner of a building. Oh dear, in a dry desert like this, you found a rose with a bright red color on it. You pick up the rose and hold it in your hand.
translation.Get the Hot Sauce.narration:
You're at the mayor's office. The doors are shut tight, and they seem like their locked. Somehow with the stench, it also smells very spicy. Besides knocking on the door, the office is so big that you probably need to shout to get his attention. What will you do?
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>Knock on the door? Or shout to the his attention?
translation.Get the Hot Sauce.reprompt: What should we do? Knock on the door? Or shout at the mayor?
translation.Get the Hot Sauce.recap: Knock on the door? Or shout at the mayor?
translation.Wave To the Window.narration: You knocked the door, but no-one responded. You need to make a bigger noise. <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Wave To the Window.reprompt: It seems that shout at the mayor is the only way to get his attention
translation.Wave To the Window.recap: It seems that shout at the mayor is the only way to get his attention
translation.Shout At the Mayor.narration: Ok then. Shout something loud and clear so that the mayor can hear you. Now let's shout!<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.Shout At the Mayor.reprompt: Ok then. Shout something loud and clear so that the mayor can hear you. Now let's shout!<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.Shout At the Mayor.recap: Seems like he is not interested in what you said. Shout something else? maybe mention that you have the super duper hot pepper sauce? <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.utterance-super duper hot blue pepper sa: super duper hot blue pepper sauce
translation.Shout At the Mayor_1.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Oh, thank you for bringing me the hot sauce. What brings you here?</voice> <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.Shout At the Mayor_1.reprompt: Wait, you come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Shout At the Mayor_1.recap: you come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Mayor Talks More About the Incident.narr:
<voice name="Joey">
        Yes. There is a cave that we know to the Eastern valleys, but all we know is that the cave is guarded by puzzles and challenges. But what's beyond that nobody knows.</voice>
translation.Mayor Talks More About the Incident.repr: you can ask about: the cave, puzzles, eastern valleys, the town, or leave to the cave
translation.Ask Mayor the valleys.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        The Eastern valleys is a long way from here. You better bring food and water. Or else you'll not make it.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor Challenges.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        We sent our best guys into the cave. <break time='0.2s'/> All they could remember when they returned was they were lost in a forest.</voice>
translation.Agree to Help the Mayor.narration:
<voice name="Joey">Wait. <break time='0.2s'/> Are you saying that you're willing to help us get rid of this disgusting smell? Oh please, sit down, sit down</voice>

        You sit down on the old couch in the mayor's office. The couch releases a spicy smell that stings.  
      
    <voice name="Joey">
        So, the legend out there says there's a precious gem hidden in the valleys to the East, and that the precious gem is the key ingredient to lifting the curse.</voice>


    <voice name="Joey">    that the don't know, is that the cavern is guarded by puzzles and challenges. But what's beyond that- nobody knows. Nobody remembers</voice>
translation.Ask the Mayor.narration: <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>You can ask about how he knows all this, about the cave, or about the town itself.
translation.Ask the Mayor.recap: Well, the options are: A. ask about how he knows all this; B. ask about the cave; C. ask about the town it self.
translation.Ask Mayor How He knows.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        A while ago we sent our best people to go and retrieve the stone. When they returned, they were covered in smell even nastier than what we have in the town. But what's worse was that they could barely remember anything. The doctor said that probably the smell was too unbearable that they passed out at some point and lost all the memory. This is all they could remember.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Strangely, some plant roots lead into the cave.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        The town has a story. I think it's the alchemist who did it.</voice>
translation.Continue Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Speaking of which, <break time='0.2s'/> this reminds me of a character, <break time='0.2s'/> yes, quite a character in our town. </voice>
        The mayor pauses to sip a cup of water. He also spreads some of the hot sauce on his nose. 
        <voice name="Joey"> 
        We had this guy who worked in one of the most famous Shawarma places in town. Everything was normal except he sweats a lot, and a lot. It's like he wasn't born for the desert. </voice>
        The hot sauce made the mayor to sweat a little bit, as he tries to wipe of some of them from his cheeks.
        <voice name="Joey">
        But it doesn't just stop there. Oh dear, he has this odor. It was offending the guests. A great embarrassment. </voice>
        The mayor leans back and waves his hands while he talks. 
        <voice name="Joey"> So, in the end, we had to make him leave. That's just a story. I don't know if anyone has hired him again, but that was just some time before this smell found its way into the town. </voice>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.narration: and you can also heave for the cave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/SoundEditing_mixdown.mp3'/>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.recap: Well, the options are: A. leave for the cave; B. ask mayor about something else
translation.Leave the Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        I hope that these information are useful to you. We're all looking forward to seeing the town coming back to life some day. Good luck! </voice>
        You leave the mayor's office, back on to the streets. The shopkeeper stands outside.
        <voice name='Brian'>
        are you leaving? bring some of these with you. If you're ready, the horse over there is ready for you; but if you're tired, take some rest. </voice>
translation.More Sauce.narration: The shopkeeper seems not happy about that, maybe we should ask for one bottle for this time?
translation.puzzle_help.narration:
If you are far away from the right direction. The flower will sing this song. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/sound_hint_s.mp3'/> 
If you are close to the right direction, the flower will sing. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/sound_hint_mr.mp3'/> 
If you are on the right direction, the flower will sing. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/sound_hint_l.mp3'/>
translation.PuzzleDemoStart.narration: <voice name="Joey">Here, If you are going to the cave in the foggy forest, you must take this compass, and the leading flower. If you are lost, the compass will show you the direction and the flower will point you the way to the cave. If you sprinkle a little dust on the leading flower. It will trace origin of smell and bring you to where the dust comes from. look, here is the dust I grab from my garden. Now, I will show you how to use it. </voice><audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> Try say, use the dust on the leading flower.
translation.PuzzleDemoStart.reprompt: <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> Try saying, use dust on the leading flower.
translation.PuzzleDemoStart.recap: <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> Try saying, use dust on the leading flower.
translation.utterance-use dust on the leading flower: use dust on the leading flower
translation.TutorialStart.narration:
You just used the dust on the leading flower. <voice name="Joey"> See. <break time='0.2s'/> The flower is responding to it. Right now you are standing at the center of my tent. You can hold the flower and look at four different directions, north, east, south, west.</voice>
<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>Try say, look south.
translation.TutorialSouth.narration:
You are looking at the south. <voice name="Joey">
Listen, the leading flower is singing you the way .</voice><audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/sound_hint_s.mp3'/><voice name="Joey">This means the direction you are looking is far away from the right direction.  </voice>
<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> Now, try saying look west.
translation.TutorialWest.narration:
You are looking at the west. 
<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/sound_hint_mr.mp3'/> 
<voice name="Joey"> This song means you are close to the right direction. </voice><audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.TutorialWest.reprompt: You can say look east or look north.
translation.TutorialWest.recap: You can say look east or look north.
translation.TutorialEast.narration: You are looking east. You are facing a wall.
translation.TutorialNorth.narration:
You are looking north.
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/sound_hint_l.mp3'/>
        <voice name="Joey">
        This song means you are right looking at the way out! Go to that direction and you will be free! </voice>
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
        Try say, go to north.
translation.TutorialEnd.narration: <voice name="Joey"> Hey, congrats! Now you are in my garden, do you understand how to use the leading flower now?</voice><audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.TutorialAgain.narration: <voice name="Joey"> <break time='0.2s'/> No worries. I can put you back to my tent, and show you again how to use the leading flower. We can go through it again if you want. Do you want to do that?</voice><audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/conversation_question.mp3"/>
translation.TutorialEnd_1.narration: <voice name="Joey"> Ok, cool. It's simple to use, right? <break time='0.2s'/> Here. Take this bottle of dust. I took it from the cave you are looking for a long time ago. <break time='0.2s'/> You are ready to go! With the leading flower, you should be able to walk across the forest! </voice>
translation.PuzzleStart.narration: You thanked the man and continute your journey. <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/puzzle_demo/footsteps2.mp3"/> Several minutes later, you are standing in front of the foggy forest.<audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.PuzzleStart.reprompt: <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> Try saying use the dust on the flower
translation.PuzzleStart.recap: <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> Try saying use the dust on the flower
